content.description: A short face with pockets, jugs, and crimp rails.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor (lap link and quick link).
content.location: Directly left of the corner with a crack in the back (the first pitch of Medicine Hole). It is the right climb of the two routes that have three bolts (seperated by about 30').

content.description: Climb the lower angle corner on good finger locks and face holds, clip a bolt then exit up and right to chain anchors. Either belay at these to reduce rope drag, or continue over a bulge to a low angle corner/ crack. Plug gear and clip bolts up this feature until you can traverse right to the bolts of Medicine Man. Climb this last fun and featured face to the chain anchor next to what I assume is the "medicine hole". Note that traverse leaves the natural line before the crack ends, so some route finding and down climbing may be required.
content.protection: Bolts and a few pieces around a BD 0.5. Longer slings may help reduce rope drag and it is possible to back clean most placements from nearby bolts.
content.location: This route is located a bit left of center on the wall, in the corner to the right of Red Bone. Look for the lone bolt protecting the steep climbing out of the upper corner.

content.description: Harder at the beginning, but easy once you are above the tree that grows out of the wall about half-way up.
content.location: Medicine Hole Wall has some north-facing and some northwest-facing routes. Cocalahishkit is in the gully right in the middle. The belay is at the top of the gully and is a little uncomfortable, but manageable.

climbs.name: Can't Roller Skate in a Buffalo Herd

content.description: Once over the the first 15 feet, it's super easy and stays at about 15 degrees less than vertical.
content.protection: 8 bolts to chains. TR is likely to result in a long pendulum past Buffaloed.
content.location: Just left of the gully for Cocalahishkit.

content.description: Crux is at the traverse near the top although the start is a tiny bit overhung with a hard to find toe hold.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chains, shares anchor with Can't Roller Skate...
